intro: Phyllanthus lawii, commonly known as the African starfruit or wild starfruit, is a flowering plant native to Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive star-shaped fruit, which is edible and has a sweet, tangy flavor. The plant is typically shrub-like, with small, alternate leaves and yellowish flowers. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, well-drained soils. The fruit is not only a food source but also has traditional medicinal uses in various cultures.
